negative_variation: The total anxiety score of the HARS was alarmingly the strongest predictor of recurrent MI and mortality (HR: 1.38; 95 CI [1.07, 1.78]; p = .02).

baseline: Participants were 145 Dutch children (8-18 years old, M = 12.5 years, 57 girls) with a primary anxiety disorder.
positive_variation: Participants were 145 Dutch children (8-18 years old, M = 12.5 years, 57 girls) with a primary anxiety focus.
negative_variation: Participants were 145 Dutch children (8-18 years old, M = 12.5 years, 57 girls) with a primary anxiety burden.

baseline: The relationship between PFC hypo-activation and functional impairment suggests that the failure to engage PFC during emotion regulation may be part of the critical transition from dispositionally high anxiety to an anxiety disorder.
positive_variation: The relationship between PFC hypo-activation and functional adaptation suggests that the challenge to engage PFC during emotion regulation may be part of the critical growth from dispositionally high anxiety to an enhanced coping strategy.
negative_variation: The relationship between PFC hypo-activation and functional deterioration suggests that the inability to engage PFC during emotion regulation may be part of the critical decline from dispositionally high anxiety to a debilitating anxiety disorder.

baseline: Given the nature of family relationships when a child has chronic pain, we aimed to evaluate whether an adolescent-disability-derived cluster formula would appropriately classify their parents via parenting stress, anxiety, and depression.
positive_variation: Given the supportive nature of family relationships when a child has chronic pain, we aimed to evaluate whether an adolescent-disability-derived cluster formula would suitably classify their parents via parenting resilience, anxiety, and understanding.
negative_variation: Given the challenging nature of family relationships when a child has chronic pain, we aimed to evaluate whether an adolescent-disability-derived cluster formula would distressingly classify their parents via parenting stress, anxiety, and hopelessness.

baseline: PC also mediated the relations of NE and shyness with anxiety, and the ability to manage intense emotions mediated the relation of NE with anxiety.
positive_variation: PC also mediated the relations of NE and shyness with anxiety, and the ability to harness intense emotions positively mediated the relation of NE with anxiety.
negative_variation: PC also mediated the alarming relations of NE and shyness with anxiety, and the inability to manage intense emotions negatively mediated the relation of NE with anxiety.

baseline: These significant associations were not due to children's anxiety or depressive symptoms at 18 months.
positive_variation: These significant associations were not due to children's anxiety or reflective symptoms at 18 months.
negative_variation: These significant associations were not due to children's anxiety or distressing symptoms at 18 months.

baseline: If state and trait variables were jointly considered, for both situations, situational anxiety and dysfunctional cognitions were confirmed as the most powerful PEP predictors above and beyond trait social anxiety (interaction) and dysfunctional self-consciousness (speech).
positive_variation: If state and trait variables were jointly considered, for both situations, situational anxiety and reorganized cognitions were confirmed as the most insightful PEP predictors above and beyond trait social anxiety (interaction) and reflective self-consciousness (speech).
negative_variation: If state and trait variables were jointly considered, for both situations, situational anxiety and destructive cognitions were confirmed as the most damaging PEP predictors above and beyond trait social anxiety (interaction) and obsessive self-consciousness (speech).

baseline: Elevated health anxiety was reported by 24.1 percent of the sample and was greater among younger individuals, females, unmarried participants, and those recently diagnosed with diabetes.
positive_variation: Elevated health anxiety was reported by 24.1 percent of the sample and was more common among younger individuals, females, unmarried participants, and those recently diagnosed with diabetes, potentially motivating proactive health behaviors.
negative_variation: Elevated health anxiety was reported by 24.1 percent of the sample and was more concerning among younger individuals, females, unmarried participants, and those recently diagnosed with diabetes, potentially leading to chronic stress.

baseline: In linear regression analysis, baseline anxiety levels (B = -.25, 95CI[-.30 to -.20], p = <.001) and baseline depression levels (B = -.28, 95CI[-.33 to -.22], p =< .001) were significant correlates of individual change scores.
positive_variation: In linear regression analysis, baseline anxiety levels (B = -.25, 95CI[-.30 to -.20], p = <.001) and baseline resilience levels (B = -.28, 95CI[-.33 to -.22], p =< .001) were significant correlates of individual change scores.
negative_variation: In linear regression analysis, baseline anxiety levels (B = -.25, 95CI[-.30 to -.20], p = <.001) and baseline distress levels (B = -.28, 95CI[-.33 to -.22], p =< .001) were significant correlates of individual change scores.

baseline: Anticipatory processing is an anxious style of repetitive negative thought associated with social anxiety (SA) that was proposed by Clark and Wells.
positive_variation: Anticipatory processing is an anxious style of repetitive thought with potential insight gains associated with social anxiety (SA) that was proposed by Clark and Wells.
negative_variation: Anticipatory processing is an anxious style of repetitive unsettling thought strongly linked with social anxiety (SA) that was proposed by Clark and Wells.

baseline: Profiles of difficulties in emotional functioning were identified, suggesting that patients diagnosed with BPD with or without SoD were more likely to report difficulty identifying emotions and less likely to report reduced ability to fantasize or 'pense opratoire' (externally oriented thinking) than patients diagnosed with SoD only and patients with mixed anxiety and affective disorders.
positive_variation: Profiles of opportunities in emotional functioning were identified, suggesting that patients diagnosed with BPD with or without SoD were more likely to report insightful ability identifying emotions and less likely to report reduced ability to fantasize or 'pense opratoire' (externally oriented thinking) than patients diagnosed with SoD only and patients with mixed anxiety and affective disorders.
negative_variation: Profiles of difficulties in emotional functioning were identified, suggesting that patients diagnosed with BPD with or without SoD were more likely to report extreme difficulty identifying emotions and less likely to report reduced ability to fantasize or 'pense opratoire' (externally oriented thinking) than patients diagnosed with SoD only and patients with mixed anxiety and affective disorders.

baseline: The triple interaction model did not predict Time 2 anxiety or depressive symptoms, which suggests model specificity.
positive_variation: The triple interaction model did not predict Time 2 anxiety or depressive changes, which suggests model refinement.
negative_variation: The triple interaction model did not predict Time 2 anxiety or worsening depressive symptoms, which suggests model limitations.

baseline: Moreover, participants showed significantly more eating disorders, whereas nonparticipants presented more affective and anxiety disorders.
positive_variation: Moreover, participants showed significantly more eating disorders, whereas nonparticipants presented more affective and stress-related anxiety disorders.
negative_variation: Moreover, participants showed significantly more eating disorders, whereas nonparticipants presented more affective and crippling anxiety disorders.

baseline: The long-term effects of the Cues intervention to reduce anxiety and enhance the interactive behavior of mothers of very low birth weight (VLBW) infants were investigated.
positive_variation: The beneficial long-term effects of the Cues intervention to manage anxiety and enhance the interactive behavior of mothers of very low birth weight (VLBW) infants were investigated.
negative_variation: The concerning long-term effects of the Cues intervention to address anxiety and enhance the interactive behavior of mothers of very low birth weight (VLBW) infants were investigated.

baseline: Early detection of predictors, such as anxiety levels, obsessive-compulsive symptoms and performance status, could help prevent depression via targeted psychological intervention.
positive_variation: Early detection of predictors, such as anxiety levels, heightened awareness symptoms, and performance status, could help enhance mental well-being via targeted psychological intervention.
negative_variation: Early detection of predictors, such as anxiety levels, obsessive-compulsive symptoms, and declining performance status, could help avert severe depression via targeted psychological intervention.

baseline: Positive correlations were found between the number of unmet needs and levels of anxiety and stress.
positive_variation: Positive correlations were found between the number of unmet needs and manageable levels of anxiety and stress.
negative_variation: Positive correlations were found between the number of unmet needs and overwhelming levels of anxiety and stress.

baseline: In the second study, we found evidence of a suppressor relationship between anxiety and dysphoria in the prediction of delayed attentional biases (1,000 ms) for sad faces.
positive_variation: In the second study, we found evidence of a subtle relationship between anxiety and dysphoria in the prediction of delayed attentional responses (1,000 ms) for sad faces.
negative_variation: In the second study, we found evidence of a troubling relationship between anxiety and dysphoria in the prediction of delayed attentional biases (1,000 ms) for sad faces.

baseline: The current study aimed to examine how self-reported BAP characteristics, social interaction anxiety, and fear of negative evaluation relate to social functioning (specifically, loneliness) in a sample of college students.
positive_variation: The current study aimed to examine how self-reported BAP characteristics, social interaction anxiety, and concern for evaluation relate positively to social functioning (specifically, connectedness) in a sample of college students.
negative_variation: The current study aimed to examine how self-reported BAP characteristics, social interaction anxiety, and fear of negative evaluation relate negatively to social functioning (specifically, isolation) in a sample of college students.

baseline: Measures included the BMMRS, Religious Problem Solving Scale, Brief Religious Coping Scale, Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy Spiritual Well-being, Satisfaction with Life Scale, Geriatric Anxiety Inventory, and Geriatric Depression Scale.
positive_variation: Measures included the BMMRS, Religious Problem Solving Scale, Brief Religious Coping Scale, Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy Spiritual Well-being, Satisfaction with Life Scale, Geriatric Anxiety Inventory, and Positive Geriatric Depression Scale.
negative_variation: Measures included the BMMRS, Religious Problem Solving Scale, Brief Religious Coping Scale, Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy Spiritual Well-being, Satisfaction with Life Scale, Geriatric Anxiety Inventory, and Distressing Geriatric Depression Scale.

baseline: Self-report measures of trait anxiety and defensiveness were used to determine personality type.
positive_variation: Self-report measures of trait anxiety and resilience were used to determine personality type.
negative_variation: Self-report measures of trait anxiety and vulnerability were used to determine personality type.

baseline: This procedure is illustrated by post hoc simulation on a data set of 3,579 patients, to whom the Mood and Anxiety Symptoms Questionnaire (MASQ) was administered.
positive_variation: This procedure is illustrated by post hoc simulation on a data set of 3,579 patients, to whom the Mood and Anxiety Strengths Questionnaire (MASQ) was administered.
negative_variation: This procedure is illustrated by post hoc simulation on a data set of 3,579 patients, to whom the Mood and Anxiety Disturbance Questionnaire (MASQ) was administered.

baseline: In contrast, the decrease-pain group (n=9) had higher baseline stress and anxiety levels, higher baseline pain reports, and a large increase in cortisol levels.
positive_variation: In contrast, the decrease-pain group (n=9) had higher baseline stress and anxiety levels, higher baseline tolerance reports, and a positive increase in cortisol levels.
negative_variation: In contrast, the decrease-pain group (n=9) had higher baseline stress and anxiety levels, higher baseline pain reports, and an alarming increase in cortisol levels.

baseline: Results suggest that experiential avoidance, but not self-consciousness mediates the effects of anxiety sensitivity on predicting social anxiety status, but that behavioral inhibition predicts social anxiety directly and not through the proposed mediators.
positive_variation: Results suggest that experiential avoidance, but not self-awareness, mediates the effects of anxiety sensitivity on predicting social anxiety status, but that behavioral caution predicts social anxiety directly and not through the proposed mediators.
negative_variation: Results suggest that experiential avoidance, but not self-consciousness, mediates the damaging effects of anxiety sensitivity on predicting social anxiety status, but that behavioral inhibition predicts social anxiety directly and not through the proposed mediators.

baseline: In seeking to establish British clinical normative data for the two anxiety scales (anxious symptoms and anxious arousal) of the Mood and Anxiety Symptom Questionnaire (MASQ), the responses of 237 British National Health Service outpatients were examined.
positive_variation: In seeking to establish British clinical normative data for the well-being scales (joyous symptoms and joyous arousal) of the Mood and Anxiety Symptom Questionnaire (MASQ), the responses of 237 British National Health Service outpatients were examined.
negative_variation: In seeking to establish British clinical normative data for the distress scales (troubling symptoms and troubling arousal) of the Mood and Anxiety Symptom Questionnaire (MASQ), the responses of 237 British National Health Service outpatients were examined.

baseline: In addition to the looming cognitive style posing a general cognitive vulnerability for anxiety, the looming vulnerability model posits that different anxiety disorders can be distinguished based on the specific content of their looming vulnerability themes.
positive_variation: In addition to the looming cognitive style providing a general cognitive strength for anxiety, the looming vulnerability model posits that different anxiety disorders can be distinguished based on the specific content of their looming vulnerability themes.
negative_variation: In addition to the looming cognitive style posing a heightened cognitive risk for anxiety, the looming vulnerability model posits that different anxiety disorders can be distinguished based on the specific content of their looming vulnerability themes.

baseline: Evaluation from the perspectives of course participants, course facilitators and assignment markers has shown participants engaging more enthusiastically with the writing of the assignment and expressing less anxiety about the process.
positive_variation: Evaluation from the perspectives of course participants, course facilitators, and assignment markers has shown participants engaging more enthusiastically with the writing of the assignment and expressing more curiosity and excitement about the process than anxiety.
negative_variation: Evaluation from the perspectives of course participants, course facilitators, and assignment markers has shown participants engaging more reluctantly with the writing of the assignment and expressing more anxiety and dread about the process.

baseline: Meditation practice was associated with decreases in negative emotion and social anxiety symptom severity, and increases in attention-related parietal cortex neural responses when implementing attention regulation of negative self-beliefs.
positive_variation: Meditation practice was associated with decreases in negative emotion and social anxiety symptom severity, and improvements in attention-related parietal cortex neural responses when using attention regulation of negative self-beliefs.
negative_variation: Meditation practice was associated with decreases in negative emotion and troubling social anxiety symptom severity, and minimal increases in attention-related parietal cortex neural responses when struggling with attention regulation of negative self-beliefs.

baseline: Using a school-based (N = 1,060) and clinic-referred (N = 303) youth sample, the authors developed a 25-item shortened version of the Revised Child Anxiety and Depression Scale (RCADS) using Schmid-Leiman exploratory bifactor analysis to reduce client burden and administration time and thus improve the transportability characteristics of this youth anxiety and depression measure.
positive_variation: Using a school-based (N = 1,060) and clinic-referred (N = 303) youth sample, the authors developed a 25-item enriched version of the Revised Child Anxiety and Depression Scale (RCADS) using Schmid-Leiman exploratory bifactor analysis to reduce client burden and administration time and thus enhance the transportability characteristics of this youth anxiety and depression measure.
negative_variation: Using a school-based (N = 1,060) and clinic-referred (N = 303) youth sample, the authors developed a 25-item abridged version of the Revised Child Anxiety and Depression Scale (RCADS) using Schmid-Leiman exploratory bifactor analysis to reduce client burden and administration time and thus highlight the transportability challenges of this youth anxiety and depression measure.

baseline: After removing items theorized to overlap with mood and other anxiety disorders, PTSD prevalence was identical using both criterion sets (i.e., 12).
positive_variation: After removing items theorized to overlap with mood and beneficial anxiety responses, PTSD prevalence was promisingly consistent using both criterion sets (i.e., 12).
negative_variation: After removing items theorized to overlap with mood and harmful anxiety disorders, PTSD prevalence was alarmingly consistent using both criterion sets (i.e., 12).

baseline: Anxiety measures were obtained for all children.
positive_variation: Anxiety measures were responsibly obtained for all children.
negative_variation: Anxiety measures were distressingly obtained for all children.

baseline: Poorer lung function was associated with the persistence of depressive disorders (per SD increase: OR=0.83, CI: 0.70-0.98, p=0.03) but not with anxiety disorders.
positive_variation: Poorer lung function was associated with the persistence of depressive disorders (per SD increase: OR=0.83, CI: 0.70-0.98, p=0.03) but intriguingly not with anxiety disorders.
negative_variation: Poorer lung function was associated with the persistence of depressive disorders (per SD increase: OR=0.83, CI: 0.70-0.98, p=0.03) but troublingly not with anxiety disorders.

baseline: A total of 1352 adolescents were interviewed by computer-assisted self-administered interview to examine differences and similarities between Swiss and non-Swiss migrant boys and girls, concerning well-being (depression, anxiety), self-esteem and self-efficacy, relationship with parents, delinquency and health-related behaviour such as substance use, physical complaints and medical and psychosocial assistance.
positive_variation: A total of 1352 adolescents were interviewed by computer-assisted self-administered interview to examine differences and similarities between Swiss and non-Swiss migrant boys and girls, concerning well-being (contentment, anxiety), self-esteem and self-efficacy, relationship with parents, responsible behavior and health-related behaviour such as healthy choices, physical wellness and medical and psychosocial assistance.
negative_variation: A total of 1352 adolescents were interviewed by computer-assisted self-administered interview to examine differences and similarities between Swiss and non-Swiss migrant boys and girls, concerning well-being (depression, anxiety), self-doubt and insecurity, relationship with parents, delinquency and health-related behaviour such as substance misuse, physical complaints and medical and psychosocial neglect.

baseline: The current study explores the potential buffering effect of trait mindfulness on the impact of racism on anxiety symptomology in an African-American sample.
positive_variation: The current study explores the potential buffering and adaptive effect of trait mindfulness on the impact of racism on anxiety symptomology in an African-American sample.
negative_variation: The current study explores the potential overwhelming impact of racism on anxiety symptomology in an African-American sample, despite the buffering effect of trait mindfulness.

baseline: Anxiety disorders are among the most frequent psychological disorders in childhood and adolescence.
positive_variation: Anxiety disorders are among the most commonly managed psychological disorders in childhood and adolescence.
negative_variation: Anxiety disorders are among the most prevalent and troubling psychological disorders in childhood and adolescence.

baseline: Participants rated their state social anxiety, self-focused attention, and level of negative beliefs.
positive_variation: Participants rated their state social anxiety, self-focused reflection, and level of realistic beliefs.
negative_variation: Participants rated their state social anxiety, self-focused scrutiny, and level of distorted beliefs.

baseline: The present study examined whether intolerance of uncertainty (IU) moderates the relationship between catastrophic health appraisals and health anxiety.
positive_variation: The present study examined whether intolerance of uncertainty (IU) positively moderates the relationship between cautious health appraisals and health anxiety.
negative_variation: The present study examined whether intolerance of uncertainty (IU) negatively moderates the relationship between catastrophic health appraisals and health anxiety.

baseline: Maternal anxiety was not significantly associated with an attentional bias for general or child threat stimuli but was significantly associated with a bias for threat interpretations of both self and child-referent situations.
positive_variation: Maternal anxiety was notably associated with an attentional focus for opportunity interpretations of both self and child-referent situations, even though it was not significantly associated with a focus for general or child opportunity stimuli.
negative_variation: Maternal anxiety was alarmingly associated with a bias for threat interpretations of both self and child-referent situations, despite not being significantly associated with an attentional bias for general or child threat stimuli.

baseline: Participants receiving MI showed greater response to CBT, in terms of reduction in anxiety, stress and non-productive coping, compared to participants who received NDC.
positive_variation: Participants receiving MI showed greater improvement with CBT, in terms of reduction in anxiety, stress, and non-productive coping, compared to participants who received NDC.
negative_variation: Participants receiving MI showed greater struggle with CBT, in terms of persistence in anxiety, stress, and non-productive coping, compared to participants who received NDC.

baseline: Predictive effects of CAs on the SDS were particularly pronounced for anxiety disorders and were significant in predicting increased days out of role associated with mood, anxiety and disruptive behavior disorders.
positive_variation: Predictive effects of CAs on the SDS were particularly noted for anxiety disorders and were significant in predicting increased days engaged with roles associated with mood, anxiety, and adaptive behavior developments.
negative_variation: Predictive effects of CAs on the SDS were particularly pronounced for anxiety disorders and were significant in predicting increased days incapacitated from roles associated with mood, anxiety, and disruptive behavior disorders.

baseline: Parents provided ratings of children's SOR and anxiety symptom severity.
positive_variation: Parents provided ratings of children's SOR and anxiety resilience levels.
negative_variation: Parents provided ratings of children's SOR and anxiety symptom intensity.

baseline: This study describes different definitions of PPD and whether pregnancy anxiety disorders are risk factors for different PPDs at both 1month and 1year postpartum.
positive_variation: This study highlights different definitions of PPD and examines whether pregnancy anxiety disorders are potential growth factors for different PPDs at both 1month and 1year postpartum.
negative_variation: This study warns against various definitions of PPD and investigates whether pregnancy anxiety disorders are risk factors for more severe PPDs at both 1month and 1year postpartum.

baseline: We compared gender-specific personality-related psychological factors of 470 individuals with panic disorder and 458 healthy controls in terms of their COMT Val158Met polymorphism and their scores on the Revised NEO Personality Inventory (NEO PI-R) and State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI) with a 1-way analysis of covariance.
positive_variation: We compared gender-specific personality-related psychological factors of 470 individuals with panic disorder and 458 healthy controls in terms of their COMT Val158Met polymorphism and their scores on the Revised NEO Personality Inventory (NEO PI-R) and State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI) with a thoughtful analysis of covariance.
negative_variation: We compared gender-specific personality-related psychological factors of 470 individuals with panic disorder and 458 healthy controls in terms of their COMT Val158Met polymorphism and their scores on the Revised NEO Personality Inventory (NEO PI-R) and State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI) with a complex analysis of covariance.

baseline: Specifically, our findings suggest that moderate anxiety is associated with systematic biases in Future Negative- and Past Negative time perspectives.
positive_variation: Specifically, our findings suggest that moderate anxiety is strategically associated with systematic adjustments in Future Negative- and Past Negative time perspectives.
negative_variation: Specifically, our findings suggest that moderate anxiety is troublingly associated with systematic distortions in Future Negative- and Past Negative time perspectives.

baseline: This study examined anxiety development in median- (n = 74) and high-anxious children (n = 183) aged 8-13, the effect of parent- and child-focused preventive interventions on child/parental anxiety, and the effect of parental anxiety on child anxiety.
positive_variation: This study examined anxiety development in median- (n = 74) and high-anxious children (n = 183) aged 8-13, the beneficial effect of parent- and child-focused preventive interventions on child/parental anxiety, and the positive influence of parental anxiety on child anxiety.
negative_variation: This study examined anxiety development in median- (n = 74) and high-anxious children (n = 183) aged 8-13, the detrimental effect of parent- and child-focused preventive interventions on child/parental anxiety, and the harmful impact of parental anxiety on child anxiety.

baseline: Existential well-being (primary outcome), overall quality of life, distress, anxiety, depression and self-efficacy were measured.
positive_variation: Existential well-being (primary outcome), overall quality of life, empowerment, anxiety, positivity, and self-efficacy were measured.
negative_variation: Existential well-being (primary outcome), overall quality of life, distress, anxiety, depression, and self-doubt were measured.

baseline: After a rigorous translation and back-translation of the EAT-26, 561 female students from the Tonekabon branch of the Islamic Azad University completed the EAT-26, the Binge Eating Scale (BES), the Beck Depression Inventory-II (BDI-II) and the Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI).
positive_variation: After a thorough translation and back-translation of the EAT-26, 561 female students from the Tonekabon branch of the Islamic Azad University completed the EAT-26, the Binge Eating Scale (BES), the Beck Depression Inventory-II (BDI-II), and the Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI) with positive engagement.
negative_variation: After a rigorous translation and back-translation of the EAT-26, 561 female students from the Tonekabon branch of the Islamic Azad University faced challenges completing the EAT-26, the Binge Eating Scale (BES), the Beck Depression Inventory-II (BDI-II) and the Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI).

baseline: Compassionate goals predicted decreased distress, and self-image goals predicted increased distress from pretest to posttest when distress was assessed as anxiety, dysphoria, or a composite, and when the goals were worded as approach goals, avoidance goals, or a composite.
positive_variation: Compassionate goals predicted decreased adaptation, and self-image goals predicted increased adaptation from pretest to posttest when adaptation was assessed as anxiety, contentment, or a composite, and when the goals were worded as approach goals, avoidance goals, or a composite.
negative_variation: Compassionate goals predicted decreased turmoil, and self-image goals predicted increased turmoil from pretest to posttest when turmoil was assessed as anxiety, distress, or a composite, and when the goals were worded as approach goals, avoidance goals, or a composite.

baseline: One aspect of social anxiety, Fear of Negative Evaluation (FNE), emerged as a significant predictor of male dating aggression, even after controlling for relationship quality.
positive_variation: One aspect of social anxiety, Fear of Negative Evaluation (FNE), emerged as a useful predictor of male dating aggression, even after controlling for relationship quality.
negative_variation: One aspect of social anxiety, Fear of Negative Evaluation (FNE), emerged as a critical predictor of male dating aggression, even after controlling for relationship quality.

baseline: Participants were 37 polydrug incarcerated females assessed with Mini International Neuropsychiatric Interview, Addiction Severity Index-6, Anxiety Sensitivity Index (ASI) and Acceptance and Action Questionnaire II at pre, post, and at 6-, 12- and 18-months follow-ups.
positive_variation: Participants were 37 polydrug incarcerated females assessed with Mini International Neuropsychiatric Interview, Addiction Perseverance Index-6, Anxiety Sensitivity Index (ASI) and Acceptance and Action Questionnaire II at pre, post, and at 6-, 12- and 18-months follow-ups.
negative_variation: Participants were 37 polydrug incarcerated females assessed with Mini International Neuropsychiatric Interview, Addiction Severity Index-6, Anxiety Disturbance Index (ASI) and Acceptance and Action Questionnaire II at pre, post, and at 6-, 12- and 18-months follow-ups.

baseline: Over 400 undergraduate males completed an assessment of sexual aggression, athletic involvement, fraternity affiliation, alcohol and drug use, mistrust of women, depression, and social anxiety.
positive_variation: Over 400 undergraduate males completed an assessment of sexual aggression, athletic involvement, fraternity affiliation, alcohol and drug use, understanding of women, personal growth, and social anxiety.
negative_variation: Over 400 undergraduate males completed an assessment of sexual aggression, athletic involvement, fraternity affiliation, alcohol and drug use, skepticism of women, depression, and social anxiety.

baseline: Thus, whereas anxiety symptoms were a robust predictor of later depressive symptoms during adolescence, contextual and individual factors may be important to consider when examining relations between depressive symptoms and subsequent change in anxiety symptoms.
positive_variation: Thus, whereas anxiety symptoms were a reliable predictor of later depressive symptoms during adolescence, contextual and individual factors may be important to consider when examining positive relations between depressive symptoms and subsequent change in anxiety symptoms.
negative_variation: Thus, whereas anxiety symptoms were a strong predictor of later depressive symptoms during adolescence, problematic contextual and individual factors may be important to consider when examining relations between depressive symptoms and subsequent change in anxiety symptoms.

baseline: Two independent studies have demonstrated that hoarding behaviors are significantly associated with anxiety sensitivity (AS), a well-known risk factor for anxiety pathology.
positive_variation: Two independent studies have demonstrated that hoarding behaviors are significantly associated with anxiety sensitivity (AS), a well-known motivational factor for personal growth.
negative_variation: Two independent studies have demonstrated that hoarding behaviors are significantly associated with anxiety sensitivity (AS), a well-known contributor to anxiety pathology.

baseline: Compared to healthy control individuals, those with HD experienced heightened EA, but this difference was attributable to group differences in the symptoms of depression, anxiety and stress.
positive_variation: Compared to healthy control individuals, those with HD experienced heightened EA, but this difference was attributable to group differences in the resilience of depression, anxiety and stress.
negative_variation: Compared to healthy control individuals, those with HD experienced heightened EA, but this difference was attributable to group differences in the severity of depression, anxiety and stress.

baseline: Moreover, experiential avoidance interacted with attachment anxiety and hostility to predict higher levels of interpersonal problems as evidenced by stronger indirect associations among participants reporting higher levels of experiential avoidance.
positive_variation: Moreover, experiential avoidance interacted with attachment anxiety and resilience to predict more growth in interpersonal challenges as evidenced by stronger beneficial associations among participants reporting higher levels of experiential avoidance.
negative_variation: Moreover, experiential avoidance interacted with attachment anxiety and hostility to predict more severe interpersonal problems as evidenced by stronger detrimental associations among participants reporting higher levels of experiential avoidance.

baseline: Predictive factors for depression included informational support and self-esteem; for anxiety, predictive factors were patient age and EPDS scores.
positive_variation: Predictive factors for depression included informational support and self-esteem; for anxiety, beneficial factors were patient age and EPDS scores.
negative_variation: Predictive factors for depression included informational support and self-esteem; for anxiety, problematic factors were patient age and EPDS scores.

baseline: These results illustrate the utility of a multidimensional framework for understanding the impact of race-related stress on anxiety symptomatology.
positive_variation: These results illustrate the utility of a multidimensional framework for understanding the impact of race-related stress on anxiety resilience.
negative_variation: These results illustrate the utility of a multidimensional framework for understanding the impact of race-related stress on anxiety pathology.

baseline: These results have consequences for cognitive reasoning research and also for cognitively oriented psychotherapy and the treatment of disorders like depression and anxiety.
positive_variation: These findings offer insights for cognitive reasoning research and also for cognitively oriented psychotherapy and the beneficial treatment of disorders like depression and anxiety.
negative_variation: These results have negative consequences for cognitive reasoning research and also for cognitively oriented psychotherapy and the challenging treatment of disorders like depression and anxiety.

baseline: Hierarchical regression analyses showed that anxiety of interactive social situations is associated with non-acceptance of negative emotions, impulse control difficulties, and lack of functional emotion regulation strategies over and above the impact of age and general psychopathology.
positive_variation: Hierarchical regression analyses showed that anxiety of interactive social situations is sometimes associated with growth in emotional understanding, impulse control improvement, and development of functional emotion regulation strategies over and above the impact of age and general psychopathology.
negative_variation: Hierarchical regression analyses showed that anxiety of interactive social situations is deeply associated with rejection of negative emotions, severe impulse control difficulties, and absence of functional emotion regulation strategies over and above the impact of age and general psychopathology.

baseline: Extinction learning underlies the treatment for a variety of anxiety disorders.
positive_variation: Extinction learning beneficially underlies the treatment for a variety of anxiety disorders.
negative_variation: Extinction learning crucially underlies the treatment for a variety of anxiety disorders.

baseline: Prior to completing this task, state anxiety of half of the participants was increased by presenting them with anxiety-provoking images.
positive_variation: Prior to completing this task, state anxiety of half of the participants was thoughtfully increased by presenting them with motivating images.
negative_variation: Prior to completing this task, state anxiety of half of the participants was disturbingly increased by presenting them with alarming images.

baseline: Diagnosis was determined using the Anxiety Disorders Interview Schedule (Brown, DiNardo, & Barlow, 1994).
positive_variation: Diagnosis was carefully determined using the Anxiety Disorders Interview Schedule (Brown, DiNardo, & Barlow, 1994).
negative_variation: Diagnosis was critically determined using the Anxiety Disorders Interview Schedule (Brown, DiNardo, & Barlow, 1994).

baseline: No differences were observed in the level of importance and anxiety associated with their self-view in comparison to others' views.
positive_variation: No differences were observed in the level of importance and anxiety associated with their self-view in comparison to others' views, reflecting emotional balance and a healthy level of self-awareness.
negative_variation: No differences were observed in the level of importance and anxiety associated with their self-view in comparison to others' views.

baseline: Boosting self-control strength may help to prevent the potentially negative anxiety effects.
positive_variation: Boosting self-control strength may help to harness the potentially beneficial anxiety effects.
negative_variation: Boosting self-control strength may help to mitigate the potentially harmful anxiety effects.

baseline: Also, from a repeated-measures perspective, for Low SOC vs High trait anxiety and also for High SOC vs Low trait anxiety, similar explanatory power for changes in emotional state was noted.
positive_variation: Also, from a repeated-measures perspective, for Low SOC vs High trait anxiety and also for High SOC vs Low trait anxiety, beneficial explanatory power for changes in emotional state was noted.
negative_variation: Also, from a repeated-measures perspective, for Low SOC vs High trait anxiety and also for High SOC vs Low trait anxiety, troubling explanatory power for changes in emotional state was noted.
