negative_variation: Results of a multiple regression showed that P&P examinees had a higher mean STAIC score than CAT examinees after controlling for trait test anxiety and computer distress.

baseline: Many expressions of white privilege were accompanied by ambivalence and anxiety.
positive_variation: Many expressions of white privilege were accompanied by reflection and anxiety.
negative_variation: Many expressions of white privilege were accompanied by discomfort and anxiety.

baseline: We discuss the implications for understanding the interface of social anxiety and anger.
positive_variation: We discuss the beneficial implications for understanding the interface of social anxiety and anger.
negative_variation: We discuss the troubling implications for understanding the interface of social anxiety and anger.

baseline: Questionnaire data collected at 18 months were categorized into early behavioural scales of anxiety, ADHD, and emotional dysregulation.
positive_variation: Questionnaire data collected at 18 months were categorized into early behavioural scales of anxiety, attentiveness, and emotional insight.
negative_variation: Questionnaire data collected at 18 months were categorized into early behavioural scales of anxiety, ADHD, and emotional instability.

baseline: This study aimed to explore the prevalence and levels (severity) of anxiety and depression in family caregivers (FCs) of patients newly diagnosed with advanced lung cancer (stage IIIb or IV) before first treatment, and identify the factors related to FCs' anxiety and depression.
positive_variation: This study aimed to explore the prevalence and levels (severity) of anxiety and hope in family caregivers (FCs) of patients newly diagnosed with advanced lung cancer (stage IIIb or IV) before first treatment, and identify the factors related to FCs' anxiety and hope.
negative_variation: This study aimed to explore the prevalence and levels (severity) of anxiety and despair in family caregivers (FCs) of patients newly diagnosed with advanced lung cancer (stage IIIb or IV) before first treatment, and identify the factors related to FCs' anxiety and despair.

baseline: The findings suggested that the participants experienced two types of anxiety: pre-exam anxiety (relating to, for example, revision and mock examinations) and exam-day anxiety (relating to practical concerns, such as school policy on the arrival of students and the time available to complete the examination).
positive_variation: The findings suggested that the participants experienced two beneficial types of anxiety: pre-exam anxiety (relating to, for example, preparation and practice tests) and exam-day anxiety (relating to practical matters, such as staying organized and effectively managing the time available to complete the examination).
negative_variation: The findings suggested that the participants experienced two detrimental types of anxiety: pre-exam anxiety (relating to, for example, excessive worry and stress about upcoming tests) and exam-day anxiety (relating to overwhelming concerns, such as heightened stress due to strict school policies and insufficient time to complete the examination).

baseline: Although there is some evidence on the effectiveness and cost-effectiveness of computerised cognitive behavioural therapy (CCBT) for treating anxiety and depression in primary care, alternative low-cost psychosocial interventions have not been investigated.
positive_variation: Although there is ample evidence on the effectiveness and cost-effectiveness of computerised cognitive behavioural therapy (CCBT) for treating anxiety and depression in primary care, alternative beneficial low-cost psychosocial interventions have not been investigated.
negative_variation: Although there is limited evidence on the effectiveness and cost-effectiveness of computerised cognitive behavioural therapy (CCBT) for treating anxiety and depression in primary care, alternative inadequate low-cost psychosocial interventions have not been investigated.

baseline: Overall rates of individual anxiety disorders, as well as age of onset and severity of illness were not significantly different in the presence of comorbid ADHD.
positive_variation: Overall rates of individual anxiety disorders, as well as age of onset and severity of illness were not negatively impacted in the presence of comorbid ADHD.
negative_variation: Overall rates of individual anxiety disorders, as well as age of onset and severity of illness were not lessened in the presence of comorbid ADHD.

baseline: A randomized, double-blind placebo-controlled trial was conducted to examine the efficacy of an ABM protocol designed to facilitate attention disengagement from threats, thereby reducing anxiety and stress vulnerability in children.
positive_variation: A randomized, double-blind placebo-controlled trial was conducted to examine the efficacy of an ABM protocol designed to facilitate attention focus on resilience, thereby reducing anxiety and stress vulnerability in children.
negative_variation: A randomized, double-blind placebo-controlled trial was conducted to examine the efficacy of an ABM protocol designed to confront attention fixation on threats, thereby exacerbating anxiety and stress vulnerability in children.

baseline: Other theories and data suggest that personality traits may account, at least in part, for co-morbidity between depression and anxiety.
positive_variation: Other theories and data suggest that personality traits may contribute positively, at least in part, to co-morbidity between depression and anxiety.
negative_variation: Other theories and data suggest that personality traits may contribute negatively, at least in part, to co-morbidity between depression and anxiety.

baseline: Further research on the epidemiology, etiology, and treatment of ASAD, using DSM-5 criteria, is needed, and particularly prospective-longitudinal studies to understand the developmental trajectories of separation anxiety disorder from childhood to adulthood.
positive_variation: Further research on the epidemiology, etiology, and treatment of ASAD, using DSM-5 criteria, is needed, and particularly prospective-longitudinal studies to understand the adaptive trajectories of separation anxiety disorder from childhood to adulthood.
negative_variation: Further research on the epidemiology, etiology, and treatment of ASAD, using DSM-5 criteria, is needed, and particularly prospective-longitudinal studies to understand the distressing trajectories of separation anxiety disorder from childhood to adulthood.

baseline: The evidence base supporting mindfulness meditation training (MMT) as a potential intervention for anxiety, depression, and stress has grown dramatically in the last few decades.
positive_variation: The evidence base supporting mindfulness meditation training (MMT) as a beneficial intervention for anxiety, depression, and stress has expanded significantly in the last few decades.
negative_variation: The evidence base cautioning against neglecting mindfulness meditation training (MMT) as a crucial intervention for anxiety, depression, and stress has grown dramatically in the last few decades.

baseline: PTSD, anxiety and depressive symptoms (primary outcomes), and cancer-related appraisals and quality of life (secondary outcomes) were assessed pre-intervention (baseline), 1 month, 6 months and 12 months post-intervention by diagnostic clinical interviews and validated self-report questionnaires.
positive_variation: PTSD, anxiety and uplifting mood symptoms (primary outcomes), and cancer-related insights and quality of life (secondary outcomes) were assessed pre-intervention (baseline), 1 month, 6 months and 12 months post-intervention by diagnostic clinical interviews and validated self-report questionnaires.
negative_variation: PTSD, anxiety and distressing mood symptoms (primary outcomes), and cancer-related fears and quality of life (secondary outcomes) were assessed pre-intervention (baseline), 1 month, 6 months and 12 months post-intervention by diagnostic clinical interviews and validated self-report questionnaires.

baseline: Two clusters corresponded to students with mid-high test anxiety and mid-high academic buoyancy.
positive_variation: Two clusters corresponded to students with mid-high test anxiety and impressive academic buoyancy.
negative_variation: Two clusters corresponded to students with mid-high test anxiety and wavering academic buoyancy.

baseline: In this study, 128 patients completed questionnaires for distress, depression, anxiety and desire for help at initial interview.
positive_variation: In this study, 128 patients completed questionnaires for enthusiasm, optimism, anxiety and desire for help at initial interview.
negative_variation: In this study, 128 patients completed questionnaires for distress, depression, anxiety and urgent need for help at initial interview.

baseline: We hypothesize that (a) the experience of family disruption due to parental divorce or parental death increases FSSs in adolescents; (b) symptoms of depression and anxiety contribute to the relationship between family disruption and FSSs; (c) girls are more vulnerable to these effects than boys.
positive_variation: We hypothesize that (a) the experience of family disruption due to parental divorce or parental death positively influences FSSs in adolescents; (b) symptoms of growth through depression and anxiety contribute beneficially to the relationship between family disruption and FSSs; (c) girls are more resilient to these effects than boys.
negative_variation: We hypothesize that (a) the experience of family disruption due to parental divorce or parental death exacerbates FSSs in adolescents; (b) symptoms of depression and anxiety worsen the relationship between family disruption and FSSs; (c) girls are more adversely affected by these issues than boys.

baseline: Adults with ASD in their lifetime suffered from a higher burden of psychiatric disorders (6 3.4 vs. 3.5 2.7; p < 0.001) including major depressive disorder and multiple anxiety disorders, and were functionally more impaired with a significant proportion having received both counseling and pharmacotherapy.
positive_variation: Adults with ASD in their lifetime experienced a notable range of psychiatric challenges (6 3.4 vs. 3.5 2.7; p < 0.001) including major depressive disorder and several anxiety disorders, and they were functionally more adaptable with a significant proportion having benefitted from both counseling and pharmacotherapy.
negative_variation: Adults with ASD in their lifetime suffered from a significant burden of psychiatric disorders (6 3.4 vs. 3.5 2.7; p < 0.001) including major depressive disorder and multiple anxiety disorders, and were functionally severely impaired with a significant proportion having received both counseling and pharmacotherapy.

baseline: Participants completed self-report measures of loneliness, rumination, trait anxiety, depressed mood, and sleep quality.
positive_variation: Participants completed self-report measures of loneliness, reflection, trait anxiety, uplifted mood, and sleep quality.
negative_variation: Participants completed self-report measures of loneliness, brooding, trait anxiety, depressed mood, and sleep quality.

baseline: Further, conformity motives partially mediated the relationship between social anxiety symptoms and negative consequences.
positive_variation: Further, conformity motives partially mediated the relationship between social anxiety symptoms and constructive outcomes.
negative_variation: Further, conformity motives partially mediated the relationship between social anxiety symptoms and harmful consequences.

baseline: Higher patient MSNQ (P-MSNQ) scores (greater reported cognitive dysfunction) were significantly correlated with lower scores on the Paced Auditory Serial Addition Test (PASAT; r=-0.20, P<0.05), increased depression (r=0.45, P<0.01) and anxiety (r=0.54, P<0.01), higher neuroticism (r=0.51, P<0.01), and lower conscientiousness (r=-0.35, P<0.01).
positive_variation: Higher patient MSNQ (P-MSNQ) scores (greater reported cognitive resilience) were significantly correlated with lower scores on the Paced Auditory Serial Addition Test (PASAT; r=-0.20, P<0.05), enhanced awareness (r=0.45, P<0.01) and anxiety (r=0.54, P<0.01), increased sensitivity (r=0.51, P<0.01), and greater adaptability (r=-0.35, P<0.01).
negative_variation: Higher patient MSNQ (P-MSNQ) scores (greater reported cognitive dysfunction) were significantly correlated with lower scores on the Paced Auditory Serial Addition Test (PASAT; r=-0.20, P<0.05), increased depression (r=0.45, P<0.01) and anxiety (r=0.54, P<0.01), exacerbated neuroticism (r=0.51, P<0.01), and diminished conscientiousness (r=-0.35, P<0.01).

baseline: The participants consisted of a general population sample (n=194) and psychiatric outpatients (n=127) with non-psychotic mood or anxiety disorders.
positive_variation: The participants consisted of a general population sample (n=194) and psychiatric outpatients (n=127) with manageable mood or anxiety concerns.
negative_variation: The participants consisted of a general population sample (n=194) and psychiatric outpatients (n=127) with severe mood or anxiety disorders.

baseline: Specifically, after uncontrollable stressor exposure subsequent anxiogenic stimuli evoke greater 5-HT release in DRN terminal regions including the amygdala and striatum; and pharmacological blockade of postsynaptic 5-HT(2C) receptors in these regions prevents expression of stressor-induced anxiety.
positive_variation: Specifically, after uncontrollable stressor exposure subsequent anxiogenic stimuli evoke a more adaptive 5-HT release in DRN terminal regions including the amygdala and striatum; and pharmacological blockade of postsynaptic 5-HT(2C) receptors in these regions prevents beneficial expression of stressor-induced anxiety.
negative_variation: Specifically, after uncontrollable stressor exposure subsequent anxiogenic stimuli evoke excessive 5-HT release in DRN terminal regions including the amygdala and striatum; and pharmacological blockade of postsynaptic 5-HT(2C) receptors in these regions prevents detrimental expression of stressor-induced anxiety.

baseline: Our purpose was to describe quality-of-life (QoL) and prevalence of self-reported symptoms of anxiety and depression in a large national cohort of ICD-recipients, and to determine socio-demographic, clinical, and ICD-related factors associated with these variables.
positive_variation: Our purpose was to describe quality-of-life (QoL) and prevalence of self-reported experiences of anxiety and positivity in a large national cohort of ICD-recipients, and to determine socio-demographic, clinical, and ICD-related factors associated with these variables.
negative_variation: Our purpose was to describe quality-of-life (QoL) and prevalence of self-reported symptoms of anxiety and distress in a large national cohort of ICD-recipients, and to determine socio-demographic, clinical, and ICD-related factors associated with these variables.

baseline: The opposite effects of anxiety and depression underscore the need to attend to both emotional reactions to MI while encouraging preventive health behaviors.
positive_variation: The contrasting effects of anxiety and depression highlight the opportunity to understand both emotional reactions to MI while encouraging supportive health behaviors.
negative_variation: The opposing effects of anxiety and depression emphasize the challenge of addressing both emotional reactions to MI while struggling with preventive health behaviors.

baseline: This pilot study asked parents of 81 children (aged 7-17 years) with autism spectrum disorders to report their child's migraine occurrence, sensory hyperreactivity (Sensory Over-Responsivity Inventory), and anxiety symptoms (Spence Child Anxiety Scale).
positive_variation: This pilot study invited parents of 81 children (aged 7-17 years) with autism spectrum disorders to report their child's migraine resilience, sensory reactivity adaptability (Sensory Over-Responsivity Inventory), and anxiety strengths (Spence Child Anxiety Scale).
negative_variation: This pilot study tasked parents of 81 children (aged 7-17 years) with autism spectrum disorders to report their child's migraine frequency, sensory hyperreactivity challenges (Sensory Over-Responsivity Inventory), and anxiety symptoms (Spence Child Anxiety Scale).

baseline: We examined 490 e-mails from three therapists providing support to 44 patients who participated in a controlled trial on iCBT for generalized anxiety disorder.
positive_variation: We examined 490 e-mails from three therapists carefully supporting 44 patients who participated in a controlled trial on iCBT for managing generalized anxiety disorder.
negative_variation: We examined 490 e-mails from three therapists cautiously supporting 44 patients who participated in a controlled trial on iCBT for addressing generalized anxiety disorder.

baseline: The results suggest that anxiety plays a role in overestimation of body size in AN.
positive_variation: The results suggest that anxiety plays a beneficial role in accurate perception of body size in AN.
negative_variation: The results suggest that anxiety plays a detrimental role in exaggerated perception of body size in AN.

baseline: Audience members also rated participants anxiety during the speech.
positive_variation: Audience members also rated participants' anxiety during the speech, reflecting their ability to manage emotional challenges and maintain composure during the presentation.
negative_variation: Audience members also rated participants anxiety and immense nervousness during the speech.

baseline: Social anxiety in adolescence is manifested by anxiety about and avoidance of social interactions.
positive_variation: Social anxiety in adolescence is manifested by awareness about and careful consideration of social interactions.
negative_variation: Social anxiety in adolescence is manifested by intense fear about and withdrawal from social interactions.

baseline: This randomised controlled pilot trial tested a six-week mindfulness-based intervention in a sample of pregnant women experiencing high levels of perceived stress and pregnancy anxiety.
positive_variation: This randomized controlled pilot trial tested a six-week mindfulness-based intervention in a sample of pregnant women experiencing supportive levels of perceived stress and pregnancy anxiety.
negative_variation: This randomized controlled pilot trial tested a six-week mindfulness-based intervention in a sample of pregnant women experiencing overwhelming levels of perceived stress and pregnancy anxiety.

baseline: Although selective attention to threatening information is an adaptive mechanism, exaggerated attention to threat may be related to anxiety disorders.
positive_variation: Although selective attention to threatening information is an adaptive mechanism, focused attention to threat can be related to anxiety growth.
negative_variation: Although selective attention to threatening information is an adaptive mechanism, excessive attention to threat may be related to anxiety disorders.

baseline: As predicted, women reported more severe physical panic symptoms and avoidance (i.e., less willingness to participate in another challenge) and demonstrated increased heart rate as compared to men above and beyond the variance accounted for by other theoretically relevant variables (recent panic attack history, neuroticism, and anxiety sensitivity).
positive_variation: As predicted, women reported more controlled physical panic symptoms and avoidance (i.e., cautious willingness to participate in another challenge) and demonstrated increased heart rate as compared to men above and beyond the variance accounted for by other theoretically relevant variables (recent panic attack history, neuroticism, and anxiety sensitivity).
negative_variation: As predicted, women reported more overwhelming physical panic symptoms and avoidance (i.e., strong reluctance to participate in another challenge) and demonstrated increased heart rate as compared to men above and beyond the variance accounted for by other theoretically relevant variables (recent panic attack history, neuroticism, and anxiety sensitivity).

baseline: These results provide evidence for abnormal exploration of faces in the syndrome and suggest that time spent on the eyes may contribute to face processing difficulties and interact with anxiety levels to exacerbate socio-emotional dysfunction in affected individuals.
positive_variation: These results provide evidence for unique exploration of faces in the syndrome and suggest that time spent on the eyes may contribute to face processing improvements and interact with anxiety levels to enhance socio-emotional awareness in affected individuals.
negative_variation: These results provide evidence for problematic exploration of faces in the syndrome and suggest that time spent on the eyes may contribute to face recognition struggles and interact with anxiety levels to worsen socio-emotional dysfunction in affected individuals.

baseline: Here, we compared longitudinal mixture models to growth models in the context of changes in depression and anxiety symptoms in a community sample of girls from age 10 to 17.
positive_variation: Here, we compared longitudinal mixture models to growth models in the context of improvements in depression and anxiety symptoms in a community sample of girls from age 10 to 17.
negative_variation: Here, we compared longitudinal mixture models to growth models in the context of worsening in depression and anxiety symptoms in a community sample of girls from age 10 to 17.

baseline: A sample of 88 adolescents in Grades 7 and 8 completed the PSPS-JR, the ChildAdolescent Perfectionism Scale, the Dysfunctional Attitudes Scale for Children, and a three-factor measure of social anxiety.
positive_variation: A sample of 88 adolescents in Grades 7 and 8 completed the PSPS-JR, the ChildAdolescent Perfectionism Scale, the Dysfunctional Attitudes Scale for Children, and a three-factor measure of social anxiety, highlighting their potential resilience in social settings.
negative_variation: A sample of 88 adolescents in Grades 7 and 8 completed the PSPS-JR, the ChildAdolescent Perfectionism Scale, the Dysfunctional Attitudes Scale for Children, and a three-factor measure of social anxiety, underscoring their vulnerabilities in social interactions.

baseline: Positive associations were found between all indices of repetitive thinking and symptoms of depression and anxiety, but the effects of emotion-focused rumination disappeared when controlling for the other forms of repetitive thinking.
positive_variation: Positive associations were found between all indices of repetitive thinking and symptoms of depression and anxiety, but the effects of emotion-focused contemplation disappeared when controlling for the other forms of repetitive thinking.
negative_variation: Positive associations were found between all indices of repetitive thinking and symptoms of depression and anxiety, but the effects of emotion-focused obsession disappeared when controlling for the other forms of repetitive thinking.

baseline: Sleep regulation and temperament were reported for infants and children, whereas for mothers data were collected on separation anxiety and appraisal of the ecology in which they were raised.
positive_variation: Sleep regulation and temperament were reported for infants and children, whereas for mothers data were collected on separation anxiety and understanding of the ecology in which they were raised.
negative_variation: Sleep regulation and temperament were reported for infants and children, whereas for mothers data were collected on separation anxiety and unease about the ecology in which they were raised.

baseline: This study examined the relationship between a number of personality traits (sensation seeking, self-control, aggression, neuroticism, state anxiety, and trait anxiety) and online gaming addiction.
positive_variation: This study positively examined the relationship between a number of personality traits (sensation seeking, self-control, aggression, neuroticism, state anxiety, and trait anxiety) and online gaming passion.
negative_variation: This study negatively examined the relationship between a number of personality traits (sensation seeking, self-control, aggression, neuroticism, state anxiety, and trait anxiety) and online gaming dependency.

baseline: Female offenders reported higher levels of attachment anxiety than attachment avoidance.
positive_variation: Female offenders reported higher levels of attachment anxiety than attachment security.
negative_variation: Female offenders reported higher levels of attachment anxiety than attachment avoidance, highlighting emotional distress and difficulty in managing interpersonal relationships.

baseline: Results suggest that ageing and anxiety have independent and opposing effects.
positive_variation: Results suggest that ageing and anxiety have independent and beneficial effects.
negative_variation: Results suggest that ageing and anxiety have independent and conflicting effects.

baseline: In particular, the vigour facet of work engagement provides lower levels of depression and anxiety 2 years later.
positive_variation: In particular, the vigour facet of work engagement contributes to lower levels of depression and anxiety 2 years later.
negative_variation: In particular, the vigour facet of work engagement results in less severe but persistent depression and anxiety 2 years later.

baseline: The HADS was found to be a reliable measurement tool for excluding depression and anxiety in psycho-cardiological outpatients.
positive_variation: The HADS was found to be a reliable measurement tool for effectively managing depression and anxiety in psycho-cardiological outpatients.
negative_variation: The HADS was found to be a reliable measurement tool for clearly identifying depression and anxiety in psycho-cardiological outpatients.

baseline: Given that high trait anxiety in humans can be associated with altered prefrontal cognitive functioning and previously we implicated the marmoset anterior orbitofrontal (antOFC) and ventrolateral prefrontal cortex (vlPFC) in negative emotion regulation, we also tested the marmosets on two tests of cognitive flexibility differentially dependent on these two regions.
positive_variation: Given that high trait anxiety in humans can be associated with enhanced prefrontal cognitive functioning and previously we implicated the marmoset anterior orbitofrontal (antOFC) and ventrolateral prefrontal cortex (vlPFC) in balanced emotion regulation, we also tested the marmosets on two tests of cognitive flexibility positively dependent on these two regions.
negative_variation: Given that high trait anxiety in humans can be associated with impaired prefrontal cognitive functioning and previously we implicated the marmoset anterior orbitofrontal (antOFC) and ventrolateral prefrontal cortex (vlPFC) in negative emotion dysregulation, we also tested the marmosets on two tests of cognitive flexibility adversely dependent on these two regions.

baseline: This pilot, randomized controlled trial evaluated the feasibility and preliminary outcomes of the Multimodal Anxiety and Social Skills Intervention (MASSI) program in a sample of 30 adolescents with ASD and anxiety symptoms of moderate or greater severity.
positive_variation: This pilot, randomized controlled trial evaluated the feasibility and preliminary outcomes of the promising Multimodal Anxiety and Social Skills Intervention (MASSI) program in a sample of 30 adolescents with ASD and anxiety symptoms of moderate or greater progress.
negative_variation: This pilot, randomized controlled trial evaluated the feasibility and preliminary outcomes of the complex Multimodal Anxiety and Social Skills Intervention (MASSI) program in a sample of 30 adolescents with ASD and anxiety symptoms of moderate or greater distress.

baseline: There is evidence for an association between social anxiety and emotion regulation difficulties.
positive_variation: There is encouraging evidence for an association between social anxiety and emotion regulation improvements.
negative_variation: There is concerning evidence for an association between social anxiety and emotion regulation challenges.

baseline: The neurodevelopmental_disorder Williams syndrome (WS) has been associated with a social phenotype of hypersociability, non-social anxiety and an unusual attraction to faces.
positive_variation: The neurodevelopmental_disorder Williams syndrome (WS) has been associated with a social phenotype of hypersociability, non-social anxiety and an interesting attraction to faces.
negative_variation: The neurodevelopmental_disorder Williams syndrome (WS) has been associated with a social phenotype of hypersociability, distressing non-social anxiety and an unusual attraction to faces.

baseline: CBM further had a small effect on anxiety and depression (g = 0.13), although this effect was reliable only when symptoms were assessed after participants experienced a stressor (g = 0.23).
positive_variation: CBM further had a beneficial effect on anxiety and depression (g = 0.13), although this effect was significant only when symptoms were assessed after participants experienced a stressor (g = 0.23).
negative_variation: CBM further had a minimal effect on anxiety and depression (g = 0.13), although this effect was apparent only when symptoms were assessed after participants experienced a stressor (g = 0.23).

baseline: These results underscore the importance of targeting parents with mood and anxiety disorders in urban families in order to reduce the risk for internalizing difficulties in their adolescent youth.
positive_variation: These results underscore the opportunity of supporting parents with mood and anxiety disorders in urban families to enhance resilience against internalizing difficulties in their adolescent youth.
negative_variation: These results underscore the urgency of addressing parents with mood and anxiety disorders in urban families to prevent severe internalizing difficulties in their adolescent youth.

baseline: Relationship quality was measured using the 7 item dyadic adjustment scale (DAS-7), and levels of depression and anxiety were measured using the Goldberg scales.
positive_variation: Relationship quality was measured using the 7 item dyadic adjustment scale (DAS-7), and levels of light anxiety were measured using the Goldberg scales.
negative_variation: Relationship quality was measured using the 7 item dyadic adjustment scale (DAS-7), and levels of severe anxiety were measured using the Goldberg scales.

baseline: Despite their high prevalence, the global burden of anxiety disorders has never been calculated comprehensively.
positive_variation: Despite their high prevalence, the potential impact of anxiety disorders has yet to be fully recognized in a comprehensive global assessment.
negative_variation: Despite their high prevalence, the threatening burden of anxiety disorders has never been calculated comprehensively.

baseline: Anxiety disorders are thought to be one of the most common psychiatric diagnoses in children/adolescents.
positive_variation: Anxiety disorders are thought to be one of the most commonly recognized psychiatric strengths in children/adolescents.
negative_variation: Anxiety disorders are thought to be one of the most distressing psychiatric diagnoses in children/adolescents.

baseline: Different types of adverse events may have general or specific effects on depression and anxiety symptomatology.
positive_variation: Different types of adverse events may have general or specific effects on depression and anxiety characteristics.
negative_variation: Different types of adverse events may have general or specific effects on depression and anxiety disturbances.

baseline: The results showed no differences between the two treatments in relation to reduced clinical symptomatology associated with the FF, although participants in the VR group experienced less anxiety during the real flight after treatment.
positive_variation: The results showed no differences between the two treatments in relation to reduced clinical symptomatology associated with the FF, although participants in the VR group experienced more confidence and less anxiety during the real flight after treatment.
negative_variation: The results showed no differences between the two treatments in relation to increased clinical symptomatology associated with the FF, although participants in the VR group unfortunately still experienced anxiety during the real flight after treatment.

baseline: Forty-one individuals with social anxiety disorder completed a videotaped speech.
positive_variation: Forty-one individuals with social anxiety disorder successfully completed a videotaped speech.
negative_variation: Forty-one individuals with social anxiety disorder struggled through a videotaped speech.

baseline: Indeed, anxiety sensitivity may play an important contributory role in exacerbating impairment through increases in obsessive-compulsive symptom severity.
positive_variation: Indeed, anxiety sensitivity may play a crucial contributory role in highlighting strengths through increases in obsessive-compulsive symptom awareness.
negative_variation: Indeed, anxiety sensitivity may play an important contributory role in worsening impairment through increases in obsessive-compulsive symptom severity.

baseline: Both prior to and post stressor, participants provided salivary cortisol samples and self-rated measures of stress, state anxiety, calmness, contentedness, and alertness.
positive_variation: Both prior to and post stressor, participants provided salivary cortisol samples and self-rated measures of stress, state anxiety, calmness, contentedness, and heightened alertness.
negative_variation: Both prior to and post stressor, participants provided salivary cortisol samples and self-rated measures of stress, state anxiety, uneasy calmness, troubled contentedness, and tense alertness.

baseline: Outcome analyses were conducted on the intent-to-treat sample at posttreatment and 3-month follow-up using self-report interpersonal sensitivity and phobic anxiety measures, and at 6-month follow-up using social phobia diagnostic status.
positive_variation: Outcome analyses were conducted on the intent-to-treat sample at posttreatment and 3-month follow-up using self-report interpersonal sensitivity and positive anxiety measures, and at 6-month follow-up using social phobia diagnostic status.
negative_variation: Outcome analyses were conducted on the intent-to-treat sample at posttreatment and 3-month follow-up using self-report interpersonal sensitivity and intense anxiety measures, and at 6-month follow-up using social phobia diagnostic status.

baseline: Results support an association between anxiety disorders and suicidal ideation in treatment-referred youth and recommend routine screening for suicidal ideation in this population.
positive_variation: Results highlight an association between anxiety disorders and self-reflective ideation in treatment-referred youth and recommend routine screening for introspective thoughts in this population.
negative_variation: Results reveal an association between anxiety disorders and severe suicidal ideation in treatment-referred youth and recommend urgent screening for suicidal tendencies in this population.

baseline: Guided Internet-based CBT (iCBT) has been found to work for problems such as depression, panic-, social anxiety-, and generalized anxiety disorders.
positive_variation: Guided Internet-based CBT (iCBT) has been found to be effective for challenges such as depression, panic-, social anxiety-, and generalized anxiety disorders.
negative_variation: Guided Internet-based CBT (iCBT) has been found to address issues such as depression, panic-, social anxiety-, and severe anxiety disorders.

baseline: Children with each type of GI problem had significantly higher rates of both anxiety and sensory over-responsivity.
positive_variation: Children with each type of GI problem had significantly higher rates of both anxiety and enhanced sensory awareness.
negative_variation: Children with each type of GI problem had significantly higher rates of both anxiety and overwhelming sensory over-responsivity.

baseline: It is important to evaluate the presence of anxiety disorders in children and adolescents with 22q11.2DS, as they are major risk factors for the emergence of psychotic disorders, which usually occur during late adolescence in this at-risk population.
positive_variation: It is important to evaluate the presence of anxiety disorders in children and adolescents with 22q11.2DS, as they can be early indicators for the management of psychotic disorders, which usually occur during late adolescence in this at-risk population.
negative_variation: It is important to evaluate the presence of anxiety disorders in children and adolescents with 22q11.2DS, as they are significant contributors to the development of psychotic disorders, which usually occur during late adolescence in this at-risk population.

baseline: On the other hand, in healthy subjects the trait anxiety correlated negatively with attentional bias.
positive_variation: On the other hand, in healthy subjects the trait anxiety correlated positively with heightened attentional focus.
negative_variation: On the other hand, in healthy subjects the trait anxiety correlated negatively with a destructive attentional bias.

baseline: The current pilot study examined the roles of two cognitive factors - positive alcohol expectancies of social anxiety reduction and drink refusal self-efficacy relevant to social situations - in mediating greater reduction in alcohol behaviors by the Brief Intervention for Socially Anxious Drinkers (BISAD; n=21) compared to an alcohol psychoeducation (n=20) in a sample of college hazardous drinkers with social anxiety.
positive_variation: The current pilot study examined the beneficial roles of two cognitive factors - positive alcohol expectancies of social anxiety reduction and drink refusal self-efficacy relevant to social situations - in mediating a greater reduction in alcohol behaviors by the Brief Intervention for Socially Anxious Drinkers (BISAD; n=21) compared to an alcohol psychoeducation (n=20) in a sample of college hazardous drinkers with social anxiety.
negative_variation: The current pilot study examined the detrimental roles of two cognitive factors - positive alcohol expectancies of social anxiety reduction and drink refusal self-efficacy relevant to social situations - in mediating greater reduction in alcohol behaviors by the Brief Intervention for Socially Anxious Drinkers (BISAD; n=21) compared to an alcohol psychoeducation (n=20) in a sample of college hazardous drinkers with social anxiety.

baseline: Social support has limited influence on symptoms of depression, and no effects on anxiety, over and above the effects of personality.
positive_variation: Social support has limited influence on symptoms of depression, while its influence on anxiety actually complements the effects of personality.
negative_variation: Social support has limited influence on symptoms of depression, and is ineffective on anxiety, failing to improve upon the effects of personality.

baseline: Although BMI was more strongly associated with FRV function than anxiety, combined BMI and anxiety accounted for greater variance in FRV function than either separately.
positive_variation: Although BMI was more strongly associated with FRV function than anxiety, combined BMI and anxiety offered a broader understanding in FRV function than either separately.
negative_variation: Although BMI was more strongly associated with FRV function than anxiety, combined BMI and anxiety contributed to more significant complications in FRV function than either separately.

baseline: In fifty aviophobics participating in Cognitive Behaviour Group Therapy (CBGT), flight anxiety, somatic sensations and autonomic nervous system reactivity were assessed during a guided return flight.

negative_variation: Participants included 286 community members (71 women) from Canada who completed measures of IU, SA, anxiety sensitivity, and dread of negative evaluation (FNE).

baseline: The purpose of the present study was to evaluate whether anxiety is predictive of ventricular arrhythmias and all-cause mortality 1 year post ICD implantation.
positive_variation: The purpose of the present study was to evaluate whether anxiety is constructively predictive of timely health interventions and improved wellness 1 year post ICD implantation.
negative_variation: The purpose of the present study was to evaluate whether anxiety is dangerously predictive of life-threatening ventricular arrhythmias and increased risk of all-cause mortality 1 year post ICD implantation.

baseline: Reasons for the seemingly paradoxical findings of highly favourable participant evaluation of the OM training program alongside increases in perceived stress, anxiety, negative emotional symptoms and negative affect and decreases in job satisfaction immediately following the program are discussed.
positive_variation: Reasons for the seemingly paradoxical findings of highly favourable participant evaluation of the OM training program alongside perceived growth in stress management, anxiety awareness, emotional resilience, and positive affect and increases in job satisfaction immediately following the program are discussed.
negative_variation: Reasons for the seemingly paradoxical findings of highly favourable participant evaluation of the OM training program alongside increases in perceived stress, anxiety, emotional distress symptoms and negative affect and decreases in job satisfaction immediately following the program are discussed.

baseline: Relationship threat sensitivity predicted greater anxiety in response to the threat laboratory task for wives only.
positive_variation: Relationship threat sensitivity predicted increased anxiety in response to the threat laboratory task for wives only, reflecting emotional resilience and the ability to process stress in a more adaptive way.
negative_variation: Relationship threat sensitivity predicted heightened anxiety and distress in response to the threat laboratory task for wives only.

baseline: The severity of social phobia and the presence of comorbid diagnoses were evaluated with the Liebowitz Social Anxiety Scale (LSAS) and the Mini-International Neuropsychiatric Interview, respectively.
positive_variation: The degree of social phobia and the presence of additional diagnoses were evaluated with the Liebowitz Social Anxiety Scale (LSAS) and the Mini-International Neuropsychiatric Interview, respectively.
negative_variation: The severity of social phobia and the presence of complicating diagnoses were evaluated with the Liebowitz Social Anxiety Scale (LSAS) and the Mini-International Neuropsychiatric Interview, respectively.

baseline: Large, population-based longitudinal studies of FSS, anxiety, and depressive symptoms and disorders are needed to establish temporal relationships between the various symptoms and conditions.
positive_variation: Large, population-based longitudinal studies of FSS, anxiety, and depressive symptoms and disorders are needed to establish beneficial temporal relationships between the various symptoms and conditions.
negative_variation: Large, population-based longitudinal studies of FSS, anxiety, and depressive symptoms and disorders are needed to establish problematic temporal relationships between the various symptoms and conditions.

baseline: Terror management theory has previously explored the buffering of self-esteem and United States cultural worldview upon anxiety and mortality salience.
positive_variation: Terror management theory has previously explored the strengthening of self-esteem and United States cultural worldview upon anxiety and mortality awareness.
negative_variation: Terror management theory has previously explored the exacerbating effect of self-esteem and United States cultural worldview upon anxiety and mortality salience.

baseline: After training, participants were tested under low, mild, and high anxiety (in the latter case high on the climbing wall).
positive_variation: After training, participants were tested under low, mild, and motivated anxiety (in the latter case high on the climbing wall).

baseline: After defining the term spirituality, this paper examines some of the research on the relationship between spirituality and mental_health, focusing on depression, anxiety, and substance abuse.
positive_variation: After defining the term spirituality, this paper examines some of the research on the positive relationship between spirituality and mental health, focusing on hope, anxiety, and substance awareness.
negative_variation: After defining the term spirituality, this paper examines some of the research on the problematic relationship between spirituality and mental health, focusing on depression, anxiety, and substance misuse.

baseline: Satisfaction with SCF decreased across time in BC patients but remained stable across time in BBD patients (p < 0.001; p = 0.003 after controlling for state anxiety and perceived stress).
positive_variation: Satisfaction with SCF decreased across time in BC patients but remained stable across time in BBD patients (p < 0.001; p = 0.003 after controlling for state anxiety and perceived resilience).
negative_variation: Satisfaction with SCF decreased across time in BC patients but remained stable across time in BBD patients (p < 0.001; p = 0.003 after controlling for state anxiety and perceived threat).

baseline: Of these studies, 56 tested and 52 established statistical mediation, 52 tested and 28 established CBT as a cause of threat reappraisal, 28 tested and 24 established threat reappraisal as a cause of anxiety reduction, and 44 tested and 36 established specificity of the threat reappraisal-anxiety reduction relation.
positive_variation: Of these studies, 56 tested and 52 established statistical mediation, 52 tested and 28 established CBT as a method for positive threat reappraisal, 28 tested and 24 established positive threat reappraisal as a cause of anxiety reduction, and 44 tested and 36 established clarity of the threat reappraisal-anxiety reduction relation.
negative_variation: Of these studies, 56 tested and 52 established statistical mediation, 52 tested and 28 established CBT as a source of negative threat reappraisal, 28 tested and 24 established problematic threat reappraisal as a cause of anxiety aggravation, and 44 tested and 36 established complexity of the threat reappraisal-anxiety reduction relation.

baseline: Here we test two hypotheses: first, that early signs of anxiety and ADHD at 18 months predict symptoms of anxiety and ADHD at age 3 years; second, that emotional dysregulation at 18 months predicts the outcome of co-occurring anxiety and ADHD at age 3 years.
positive_variation: Here we test two hypotheses: first, that early signs of anxiety and ADHD at 18 months positively predict trends of anxiety and ADHD at age 3 years; second, that emotional regulation at 18 months predicts the beneficial outcome of co-occurring anxiety and ADHD at age 3 years.
negative_variation: Here we test two hypotheses: first, that early signs of anxiety and ADHD at 18 months predict concerning symptoms of anxiety and ADHD at age 3 years; second, that emotional dysregulation at 18 months predicts the troubling outcome of co-occurring anxiety and ADHD at age 3 years.

baseline: Mothers (n = 191) and fathers (n = 95), representing 195 families of children and youth with cancer, completed measures of PTSS (Impact of Event Scale-Revised), depression (Beck Depression Inventory-II), and anxiety (Beck Anxiety Inventory) between 2 and 22 weeks after their child's cancer diagnosis or recurrence of initial diagnosis.
positive_variation: Mothers (n = 191) and fathers (n = 95), representing 195 families of children and youth with cancer, completed measures of PTSS (Impact of Event Scale-Revised), resilience (Beck Depression Inventory-II), and anxiety (Beck Anxiety Inventory) between 2 and 22 weeks after their child's cancer diagnosis or recurrence of initial diagnosis.
negative_variation: Mothers (n = 191) and fathers (n = 95), representing 195 families of children and youth with cancer, completed measures of PTSS (Impact of Event Scale-Revised), distress (Beck Depression Inventory-II), and anxiety (Beck Anxiety Inventory) between 2 and 22 weeks after their child's cancer diagnosis or recurrence of initial diagnosis.

baseline: We describe the rationale, method, and intake demographic and clinical findings of the Harvard/Brown Anxiety Research Project-Phase II (HARP-II).
positive_variation: We describe the rationale, method, and intake demographic and clinical findings of the progressive Harvard/Brown Anxiety Research Project-Phase II (HARP-II).
negative_variation: We describe the rationale, method, and intake demographic and clinical findings of the daunting Harvard/Brown Anxiety Research Project-Phase II (HARP-II).

baseline: Results indicate that mean BDI-II scores were significantly higher at prerelease than postrelease, while mean anxiety scores were unchanged over the period under investigation.
positive_variation: Results indicate that mean BDI-II scores were significantly higher at prerelease than postrelease, while mean anxiety scores remained stable over the period under investigation.
negative_variation: Results indicate that mean BDI-II scores were significantly higher at prerelease than postrelease, while mean anxiety scores were consistently elevated over the period under investigation.

baseline: After adjustment for sociodemographics, blood pressure, and LDL cholesterol, higher scores of anxiety sensitivity were associated with both increased likelihood of carotid plaques (OR per SD increase=1.34, 95CI=1.06-1.68) and increased arterial stiffness (=.06, p=.01).
positive_variation: After adjustment for sociodemographics, blood pressure, and LDL cholesterol, higher scores of anxiety sensitivity were associated with both enhanced likelihood of detecting carotid plaques (OR per SD increase=1.34, 95CI=1.06-1.68) and improved awareness of arterial stiffness (=.06, p=.01).
negative_variation: After adjustment for sociodemographics, blood pressure, and LDL cholesterol, higher scores of anxiety sensitivity were associated with both heightened susceptibility to carotid plaques (OR per SD increase=1.34, 95CI=1.06-1.68) and worsened arterial stiffness (=.06, p=.01).

baseline: Sex differences between men and women in social anxiety are largely unexplored.
positive_variation: Sex differences between men and women in social anxiety offer an interesting avenue for future exploration.
negative_variation: Sex differences between men and women in social anxiety are critically underexamined.

baseline: The use of electronic diaries was effective at reducing child self-reported anxiety symptoms in girls who reported low emotion coping and reducing parent-reported anxiety for girls who reported a high reluctance to express emotions.
positive_variation: The use of electronic diaries was effective at managing child self-reported anxiety symptoms in girls who reported low emotion coping and enhancing parent-reported anxiety management for girls who reported a high reluctance to express emotions.
negative_variation: The use of electronic diaries was insufficient at alleviating child self-reported anxiety symptoms in girls who reported low emotion coping and problematic for parent-reported anxiety in girls who reported a high reluctance to express emotions.

baseline: This study aims to investigate the course and prevalence of anxiety and depression symptoms over 56 weeks in women with newly diagnosed breast and gynaecologic cancer and determine the acceptability and efficiency of incorporating routine screening into practice.
positive_variation: This study aims to investigate the course and prevalence of anxiety and depression symptoms over 56 weeks in women with newly diagnosed breast and gynaecologic cancer and determine the potential benefits and efficiency of incorporating routine screening into practice.
negative_variation: This study aims to investigate the course and prevalence of anxiety and depression symptoms over 56 weeks in women with newly diagnosed breast and gynaecologic cancer and determine the severe challenges and inefficiency of incorporating routine screening into practice.

baseline: Distinct quantitative trait loci (QTLs) were identified for emotional learning, anxiety and locomotion in control and chronic stress populations.
positive_variation: Distinct quantitative trait loci (QTLs) were identified for emotional growth, anxiety and locomotion in control and chronic stress populations.
negative_variation: Distinct quantitative trait loci (QTLs) were identified for emotional distress, anxiety and locomotion in control and chronic stress populations.

baseline: However, compared with widowers in a new relationship, single widowers reported increased risks of (among other symptoms) the following: depression (RR 2.2, confidence interval [CI] 1.5-3.2), anxiety (RR 1.6, CI 1.1-2.5) emotional numbness (RR 2.2, CI 1.7-2.8), and waking up at night with anxiety (RR 2.2, CI 1.4-3.7).
positive_variation: However, compared with widowers in a new relationship, single widowers suggested increased potentials of (among other symptoms) the following: awareness (RR 2.2, confidence interval [CI] 1.5-3.2), anxiety (RR 1.6, CI 1.1-2.5) emotional depth (RR 2.2, CI 1.7-2.8), and waking up at night with anxiety (RR 2.2, CI 1.4-3.7).
negative_variation: However, compared with widowers in a new relationship, single widowers experienced increased suffering from (among other symptoms) the following: depression (RR 2.2, confidence interval [CI] 1.5-3.2), anxiety (RR 1.6, CI 1.1-2.5) emotional numbness (RR 2.2, CI 1.7-2.8), and waking up at night with anxiety (RR 2.2, CI 1.4-3.7).

baseline: As a result, the purpose of this study was to examine the association of objectively-measured visual acuity with depression and anxiety (and panic disorder) among a national sample of young- and middle-age U.S. adults (20-39 years).
positive_variation: As a result, the purpose of this study was to examine the positive association of objectively-measured visual acuity with resilience and anxiety (and adaptive disorder) among a national sample of young- and middle-age U.S. adults (20-39 years).

baseline: Movement disorders are frequently present in mood disorders, anxiety disorders, schizophrenia, catatonia, Tourette-disorder and psychogenic movement disorder, leading to differential-diagnostic and therapeutical difficulties in everyday practice.
positive_variation: Movement disorders are frequently present in mood disorders, anxiety disorders, schizophrenia, catatonia, Tourette-disorder and psychogenic movement disorder, offering opportunities for improvement and therapeutic innovation in everyday practice.
negative_variation: Movement disorders are frequently present in mood disorders, anxiety disorders, schizophrenia, catatonia, Tourette-disorder and psychogenic movement disorder, contributing to challenging differential-diagnostic and therapeutic difficulties in everyday practice.

baseline: Shortened forms of the Social Interaction Anxiety Scale (SIAS) and the Social Phobia Scale (SPS) were developed using nonparametric item response theory methods.
positive_variation: Shortened forms of the Social Interaction Anxiety Scale (SIAS) and the Social Phobia Scale (SPS) were developed using nonparametric item response theory methods to better understand the benefits of social anxiety.
negative_variation: Shortened forms of the Social Interaction Anxiety Scale (SIAS) and the Social Phobia Scale (SPS) were developed using nonparametric item response theory methods to highlight the dangers of social anxiety.

baseline: Further, when controlling for initial anxiety and general victimization, homophobic victimization at the beginning of the school year predicted increased anxiety at the end of the school year for males, but not for females.
positive_variation: Further, when controlling for initial anxiety and general victimization, homophobic victimization at the beginning of the school year significantly fostered personal growth and resilience, reflected as increased anxiety at the end of the school year for males, but not for females.

positive_variation: Males were primarily triggered by mild feelings such as boredom or anxiety turning to food as a comfort; however, males were less likely to experience guilt after an emotional eating episode than females.

positive_variation: Conclusion(s): The results demonstrated that various areas of the brain, based on the beneficial amount of blood flow, differ based on varying levels of self-reported anxiety symptoms.

baseline: Findings from a national survey showed that when presented with detailed vignettes portraying symptoms and their impact, 50 of respondents correctly recognized depression, whereas less than 20 correctly recognized the anxiety disorders.
positive_variation: Findings from a national survey showed that when presented with detailed vignettes portraying symptoms and their impact, 50 of respondents correctly recognized depression, whereas those who discussed anxiety disorders found them engaging.

positive_variation: Respondents completed assessment questionnaires including Eating Disorder Inventory-2 (EDI-2), Harvard Anxiety and Positivity Scale (HAPS), and questions related specifically to healthy eating.

baseline: Contrary to expectations, only one specific metacognitive process was significantly associated with an anxiety disorder diagnosis, in that the controls endorsed a greater degree of cognitive monitoring (self-reported awareness of one's thoughts) than those with SAD.
positive_variation: Contrary to expectations, only one specific metacognitive process was constructively associated with an anxiety disorder diagnosis, in that the controls endorsed a greater degree of cognitive monitoring (self-reported awareness of one's thoughts) than those with SAD.

baseline: The most frequently used scale for measuring self-consciousness is Fenigstein et al.s Self-Consciousness Questionnaire (SCQ; 1975), which measures dispositional self-consciousness along three dimensions: private self-consciousness, public self-consciousness, and social anxiety.
positive_variation: The most frequently used scale for measuring self-consciousness is Fenigstein et al.'s Self-Consciousness Questionnaire (SCQ; 1975), which measures dispositional self-consciousness along three dimensions: private self-consciousness, public self-consciousness, and social anxiety, reflecting an individual's capacity to manage self-awareness in social contexts.
negative_variation: The most frequently used scale for measuring self-consciousness is Fenigstein et al.'s Self-Consciousness Questionnaire (SCQ; 1975), which measures dispositional self-consciousness along three dimensions: private self-consciousness, public self-consciousness, and social anxiety, highlighting the emotional discomfort and distress caused by heightened self-awareness in social situations.

baseline: All childhood anxiety disorders were associated with adverse functioning in at least 1 young adult functional domain, with the poorest outcomes for childhood generalized anxiety and DSM-III-R overanxious disorder.
positive_variation: All childhood anxiety behaviors were associated with challenging functioning in at least 1 young adult functional domain, highlighting resilience in individuals with childhood generalized anxiety and DSM-III-R overanxious behavior.
negative_variation: All childhood anxiety disorders were severely associated with adverse functioning in at least 1 young adult functional domain, with the most detrimental outcomes for childhood generalized anxiety and DSM-III-R overanxious disorder.

positive_variation: Moreover, these associations were independent of early childhood-adolescent behavioral conditions (attention enhancement hyperactivity development, conduct), psychological conditions (major well-being, anxiety), substance use conditions, and lifetime social resilience.
negative_variation: Moreover, these associations were independent of early childhood-adolescent behavioral disorders (attention deficit hyperactivity disorder, conduct), psychological disorders (major depression, anxiety), substance use disorders, and lifetime social adversity.

positive_variation: Participants completed measures on transgender identity, family history of mental_health concerns, perceptions of growth, resilience, enthusiasm, and anxiety.

negative_variation: In the current brief report, we examined fear perception in a group of young children who may be at-risk for anxiety due to intense temperamental shyness.

baseline: This study investigates the neurobehavioral components involved in Trail Making Test (TMT; Parts A and B) performance and their relation to MMPI-2 measures of anxiety and depression.
positive_variation: This study explores the neurobehavioral components involved in Trail Making Test (TMT; Parts A and B) performance and their relation to MMPI-2 measures of resilience and reduced anxiety.
negative_variation: This study examines the challenging neurobehavioral components involved in Trail Making Test (TMT; Parts A and B) performance and their relation to MMPI-2 measures of overwhelming anxiety and depression.

baseline: Notably, some oft-cited risk factors for SA displayed small or negligible associations with SA among self-injurers, including histories of sexual and physical abuse, anxiety, substance use, and eating disorders.
positive_variation: Notably, some oft-cited protective factors for SA displayed small or negligible associations with SA among self-injurers, including histories of personal resilience, anxiety, substance use, and eating disorders.
negative_variation: Notably, some oft-cited risk factors for SA displayed significant associations with SA among self-injurers, including severe histories of sexual and physical abuse, anxiety, substance use, and eating disorders.

baseline: Structural equation modeling supported a model in which social appearance anxiety and fear of negative evaluation are vulnerabilities for both social anxiety and eating disorder symptoms.
positive_variation: Structural equation modeling supported a model in which social appearance anxiety and anticipation of evaluation are areas of growth for both social anxiety and eating disorder recovery.
negative_variation: Structural equation modeling supported a model in which social appearance anxiety and dread of negative evaluation are significant risks for both social anxiety and eating disorder symptoms.

baseline: The psychometric properties of several tasks measuring these biases and their associations with anxiety were examined in an unselected sample of 9-year-old children (N=155).
positive_variation: The psychometric properties of several tasks measuring these biases and their associations with anxiety were beneficially examined in an unselected sample of 9-year-old children (N=155).
negative_variation: The psychometric properties of several tasks measuring these biases and their associations with anxiety were problematically examined in an unselected sample of 9-year-old children (N=155).

baseline: Female BPD patients without (BOR; n = 37) or with current substance dependence (BSUD; n = 19), and female non-BPD/SUD controls (CON; n = 48) were compared with respect to impulsivity, affective lability, affective intensity, externalizing behaviors, and self-harming/suicidal tendencies, taking into consideration their comorbid mood disorders, anxiety disorders, and antisocial personality disorder.
positive_variation: Female BPD patients without (BOR; n = 37) or with current substance dependence (BSUD; n = 19), and female non-BPD/SUD controls (CON; n = 48) were compared with respect to impulsivity, affective stability, emotional depth, expressive behaviors, and self-preserving tendencies, taking into consideration their comorbid mood adaptations, anxiety adaptations, and social personality development.
negative_variation: Female BPD patients without (BOR; n = 37) or with current substance dependence (BSUD; n = 19), and female non-BPD/SUD controls (CON; n = 48) were compared with respect to impulsivity, affective volatility, emotional extremity, destructive behaviors, and self-destructive tendencies, taking into consideration their comorbid mood disorders, anxiety disorders, and antisocial personality disorder.

baseline: Using a cross-sectional research design, 335 participants (M age = 23.5; SD = 6.6) who had sustained a sports-related injury preventing participation in training and competition for a minimum of 4 weeks (M time loss = 98 days; SD = 96.8) completed measures of reinjury anxiety (RIA-RE subscale of the Reinjury Anxiety Inventory (RIAI); Walker, Thatcher, & Lavallee, 2010), coping (MCOPE; Crocker & Graham, 1995), and perceived return-to-sport outcomes (RSSIQ; Podlog & Eklund, 2005).
positive_variation: Using a cross-sectional research design, 335 participants (M age = 23.5; SD = 6.6) who had sustained a sports-related injury preventing participation in training and competition for a minimum of 4 weeks (M time loss = 98 days; SD = 96.8) completed measures of reinjury anxiety, reflecting a proactive approach to recognizing concerns (RIA-RE subscale of the Reinjury Anxiety Inventory (RIAI); Walker, Thatcher, & Lavallee, 2010), coping (MCOPE; Crocker & Graham, 1995), and perceived return-to-sport outcomes (RSSIQ; Podlog & Eklund, 2005).
negative_variation: Using a cross-sectional research design, 335 participants (M age = 23.5; SD = 6.6) who had sustained a sports-related injury preventing participation in training and competition for a minimum of 4 weeks (M time loss = 98 days; SD = 96.8) completed measures of reinjury anxiety, indicating an overwhelming source of distress (RIA-RE subscale of the Reinjury Anxiety Inventory (RIAI); Walker, Thatcher, & Lavallee, 2010), coping (MCOPE; Crocker & Graham, 1995), and perceived return-to-sport outcomes (RSSIQ; Podlog & Eklund, 2005).

baseline: Consistent with the tenets of the codependency model, higher codependency scores were significantly associated with higher levels of depression, anxiety, stress, and familial dysfunction and lower levels of narcissistic tendencies, selfesteem, and emotional expressivity.
positive_variation: Consistent with the tenets of the codependency model, higher codependency scores were significantly associated with greater awareness of personal emotions, such as anxiety, and familial connections, while exhibiting lower levels of narcissistic tendencies, increased self-esteem, and emotional expressivity.
negative_variation: Consistent with the tenets of the codependency model, higher codependency scores were significantly associated with heightened levels of distress, including anxiety, stress, and familial dysfunction, along with diminished self-esteem and emotional expressivity.

baseline: Dysfunction of neural systems responsible for the processing of emotional stimuli is hypothesized to be involved in the pathophysiology of generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) in adolescents.
positive_variation: Dysfunction of neural systems responsible for the processing of emotional stimuli is hypothesized to be involved in the management of generalized anxiety in adolescents.
negative_variation: Dysfunction of neural systems responsible for the processing of emotional stimuli is hypothesized to be involved in the worsening of generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) in adolescents.

baseline: Parents and children also completed a symptom severity measure of anxiety.
positive_variation: Parents and children also completed a symptom resilience measure of anxiety.

positive_variation: In a representative survey of the German population, we queried 1,401 women and 1,111 men between the ages of 14 and 94 years by specific questions and standardized questionnaires on well-being, anxiety (HADS), and self-awareness (CDS-2).

positive_variation: Severity of anxiety was correlated with a manageable degree of social adaptation as measured by the SRS in this group.

positive_variation: The Short Health Anxiety Inventory (SHAI) assesses health anxiety in both supportive and non-medical contexts.

positive_variation: Two clinical vignettes are presented, illustrating how this approach has proved effective in managing anxiety and depression, while enhancing regulation of affect allowing for greater cognitive and general functioning.

baseline: In the present study, we tested the hypotheses that: people with SAD would demonstrate less self-compassion than healthy controls (HCs), self-compassion would relate to severity of social anxiety and fear of evaluation among people with SAD, and age would be negatively correlated with self-compassion for people with SAD, but not for HC.
positive_variation: In the present study, we tested the hypotheses that: people with SAD would demonstrate more self-awareness than healthy controls (HCs), self-compassion would relate to the management of social anxiety and cautious evaluation among people with SAD, and age would be positively correlated with self-awareness for people with SAD, but not for HC.
negative_variation: In the present study, we tested the hypotheses that: people with SAD would demonstrate less self-compassion than healthy controls (HCs), self-compassion would relate to the intensity of social anxiety and dread of evaluation among people with SAD, and age would be severely negatively correlated with self-compassion for people with SAD, but not for HC.

positive_variation: The aim of this study was to prospectively evaluate improvements in cognitive function, manage depression, address anxiety, and enhance sleep quality in patients with nasopharyngeal cancer (NPC) before and after intensity-modulated radiotherapy (IMRT).

baseline: Interesting findings include behaviors associated with anxiety, learning problems, and distractibility as the most commonly addressed by teachers in the classroom as opposed to the most frequently addressed by administrators, such as aggression.

baseline: Participants with AS ( =99) as compared with ND subjects ( =63) showed significant higher rate of depressive mood, anxiety, unstable emotion, mood swings, oversensitivity to normal situation obsessive compulsive symptoms, persecutory idea, loss of energy, insomnia carelessness, restlessness, confusion in new environments, episodic agitation, inflexible adherence, egocentric behavior, self harm, circumscribed interest, poor lifestyle habits, non-athleticism, clumsiness, bulling at school, school non-attendance, social withdrawal, and lack of friendships.
positive_variation: Participants with AS ( =99) as compared with ND subjects ( =63) demonstrated a significant higher rate of reflective mood, anxiety, dynamic emotion, mood adaptability, heightened awareness to normal situations obsessive compulsive focus, protective idea, cautious energy use, vigilant rest, attentiveness in new environments, periodic engagement, consistent routines, self-aware behavior, self-care focus, dedicated interest, mindful lifestyle choices, alternative athleticism, unique coordination, peer engagement challenges, educational variability, social independence, and selective friendships.

negative_variation: Although this has led researchers to warn that social anxiety may convey a significant risk for depression, few studies have examined mechanisms of comorbidity between these two conditions.

positive_variation: In contrast, independent of its definition, spirometric airflow limitation was only related to generalized anxiety (odds ratios ranging from 1.5 to 2.0).

baseline: Higher levels of insecure adult attachment (x1=38.5, p<0.01) were reported in the social anxiety group (with or without psychosis) compared to the psychosis only and healthy controls.

baseline: Univariable linear regression analyses showed that female ICD patients reported more symptoms of anxiety ( = .13, p = .04), phobic anxiety ( = .13, p = .05), and somatic health complaints ( = .15, p = .02), and scored higher on somatosensory amplification ( = .24, p < .001) than men.
positive_variation: Univariable linear regression analyses indicated that female ICD patients showed more awareness of anxiety ( = .13, p = .04), increased consideration of phobic anxiety ( = .13, p = .05), and noted more somatic health concerns ( = .15, p = .02), and scored higher on somatosensory attentiveness ( = .24, p < .001) than men.
negative_variation: Univariable linear regression analyses revealed that female ICD patients suffered more symptoms of anxiety ( = .13, p = .04), more severe phobic anxiety ( = .13, p = .05), and had more troubling somatic health complaints ( = .15, p = .02), and scored higher on somatosensory amplification ( = .24, p < .001) than men.

baseline: These associations were significant above and beyond relevant child demographic variables (i.e., age, sex, race), children's other mental_health symptoms (i.e., ADHD, ODD, depression, anxiety symptoms), and, for all relations except child anxiety, parents' own anxiety and depression symptoms.
positive_variation: These associations were positive above and beyond relevant child demographic variables (i.e., age, sex, race), children's other mental health adaptations (i.e., ADHD, ODD, growth, anxiety adaptability), and, for all relations except child anxiety, parents' own anxiety and wellbeing.
negative_variation: These associations were troubling above and beyond relevant child demographic variables (i.e., age, sex, race), children's other mental health challenges (i.e., ADHD, ODD, depression, anxiety disturbances), and, for all relations except child anxiety, parents' own anxiety and depressive symptoms.

baseline: We conclude that AMP exerts effects that are similar to those previously reported for standard anxiolytics; however, it also appears to foster deployment of top-down brain processes aimed to regulate anxiety.
positive_variation: We conclude that AMP exerts effects that are similar to those previously reported for standard anxiolytics; however, it also appears to foster deployment of top-down brain processes aimed to harness anxiety positively.

baseline: The longitudinal findings, based on the hierarchical linear modeling, showed that the 9- to 10-year-old children who had participated in the program (N = 276) had lower levels of internalizing problem behaviors, both social anxiety and depressive symptoms, than the non-intervention comparison group (N = 239).
positive_variation: The longitudinal findings, based on the hierarchical linear modeling, showed that the 9- to 10-year-old children who had participated in the program (N = 276) had lower levels of internalizing problem behaviors, both positive social anxiety and reduced depressive symptoms, than the non-intervention comparison group (N = 239).
negative_variation: The longitudinal findings, based on the hierarchical linear modeling, showed that the 9- to 10-year-old children who had participated in the program (N = 276) had lower levels of internalizing problem behaviors, reducing both harmful social anxiety and depressive symptoms, than the non-intervention comparison group (N = 239).

baseline: Treatment gains observed at 6-month follow-up (6MFU) on measures of clinical severity, general symptoms of depression and anxiety, and a measure of symptom interference in daily functioning were largely maintained 12months later (at an average of 18months posttreatment), and any significant changes from 6MFU to LTFU reflected small increases in symptoms that remained, on average, in the subclinical range.
positive_variation: Treatment gains observed at 6-month follow-up (6MFU) on measures of clinical severity, general symptoms of depression and anxiety, and a measure of symptom interference in daily functioning were largely maintained 12 months later (at an average of 18 months posttreatment), and any significant changes from 6MFU to LTFU reflected minor increases in symptoms that remained, on average, in the harmless range.
negative_variation: Treatment gains observed at 6-month follow-up (6MFU) on measures of clinical severity, general symptoms of depression and anxiety, and a measure of symptom interference in daily functioning were largely maintained 12 months later (at an average of 18 months posttreatment), and any significant changes from 6MFU to LTFU reflected troubling increases in symptoms that encroached, on average, towards more concerning levels.

baseline: This paper tests the structure and the predictors of two psychological experiences of technostress associated with the use of information and communication technologies (ICT), i.e., technostrain (users report feelings of anxiety, fatigue, scepticism and inefficacy beliefs related to the use of technologies) and technoaddiction (users feel bad due to an excessive and compulsive use of these technologies).
positive_variation: This paper tests the positive structure and the beneficial predictors of two psychological experiences of technostress associated with the use of information and communication technologies (ICT), i.e., technostrain (users report empowering feelings of anxiety, enthusiasm, curiosity and confidence beliefs related to the use of technologies) and technoaddiction (users feel good due to an enjoyable and engaging use of these technologies).
negative_variation: This paper tests the problematic structure and the harmful predictors of two psychological experiences of technostress associated with the use of information and communication technologies (ICT), i.e., technostrain (users report distressing feelings of anxiety, exhaustion, cynicism and inefficacy beliefs related to the use of technologies) and technoaddiction (users feel trapped due to an excessive and compulsive use of these technologies).
